title: Steph's Bourbon Balls Recipe
description: Something between a truffle and a no-bake cookie, these are fun for grownups at Christmas (they have a kick) or to celebrate the Run for the Roses.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Specialty Dessert Recipes Liqueur Dessert Recipes Steph's Bourbon Balls 4.2 (18) 16 Reviews 5 Photos These bourbon balls are my signature Christmas candy. You'll get requests to make these every year! Submitted by Steph T Updated on January 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 Prep Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 20 Yield: 40 bourbon balls Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 20 servings ½ cup white sugar 2 ½ cups vanilla wafer crumbs ½ cup confectioners' sugar 1 cup chopped pecans 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips 3 tablespoons light corn syrup ¼ cup bourbon whiskey Directions Place the sugar in a shallow bowl, and set aside. Combine the vanilla wafer crumbs, confectioners' sugar, and pecans in a bowl, and mix well. Place the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl, and microwave on High for 1 to 2 minutes to melt the chips. Stir the melted chips until smooth, and beat in the corn syrup and whiskey. Scrape the chocolate mixture into the crumb mixture, and stir well to mix. Form the dough into 1-inch balls, and roll each ball in sugar. Place the finished bourbon balls on a cooling rack to finish setting up. Editor's Note: You can substitute your favorite whiskey or use rum or brandy. I Made It Print 29 home cooks made it! name: Steph T
instructions: Place the sugar in a shallow bowl, and set aside. Combine the vanilla wafer crumbs, confectioners' sugar, and pecans in a bowl, and mix well.;Place the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl, and microwave on High for 1 to 2 minutes to melt the chips. Stir the melted chips until smooth, and beat in the corn syrup and whiskey. Scrape the chocolate mixture into the crumb mixture, and stir well to mix.;Form the dough into 1-inch balls, and roll each ball in sugar. Place the finished bourbon balls on a cooling rack to finish setting up.
